title: Human Chess is a chess variant where playing the top engine move is forbidden

title: Isometric Pixel Art
dot:
digraph IsometricPixelArt{node[shape=box, style=filled, fontname="Helvetica", fontsize=10];edge[fontname="Helvetica", fontsize=10]; Intro[label="Intro: Isometric Pixel Art
- Based on isometric projection
- Accurate 3D-to-2D transformation
- No vanishing point, equal axis foreshortening
- Used in engineering, architecture, and games"]; Basics[label="The Basics
- Ground planes at 30° angles
- Use of 2:1 line pattern (26.5°)
- Simple geometric approach for 3D forms"]; CubeStyles[label="Cube Styles
- Varies based on personal preference
- Tiling efficiency of cubes (e.g., 2:1 grid)
- Impact of wide corners and sharp corners"]; IsoTiles[label="Isometric Tiles
- Variety of styles possible
- Cuboids with texturing
- Tiles don't need to be perfect cubes
- Uniform top surfaces, varying heights"]; IsoMech[label="Isometric Mech
- Complex designs broken into simple geometry
- Layering for flexibility in design
- Wireframe cuboids for character sprites"]; FinalThoughts[label="Final Thoughts
- Learning isometric pixel art is tedious but rewarding
- 2-step lines make it easier
- Best for turn-based strategy games
- Practice and attention to detail are key"];Intro->Basics[label="Concept Introduction"];Basics->CubeStyles[label="Understanding the Basics"];CubeStyles->IsoTiles[label="Applying Tiles"];IsoTiles->IsoMech[label="Designing Mechs"];IsoMech->FinalThoughts[label="Conclusion & Reflection"]; Resources[label="Resources
- Support via Patreon or Donation"];FinalThoughts->Resources[label="Further Engagement"];}
